item.title: Max Pham Nguyen - Fall - Justin Bieber - #BELIEVEtourAuditions
item.description: Please take a minute and thirty seconds to watch this guys http://t.co/WKeEktnn watch in HD @justinbieber #BELIEVEtourAuditions
item.content:encoded: Please take a minute and thirty seconds to watch this guys http://t.co/WKeEktnn watch in HD @justinbieber #BELIEVEtourAuditions @MaxPhamNguyen - max.pham.nguyen@gmail.com If this video made an impact on your or just made you smile, please let me know and help me spread the word :) Repost, Share, Tweet, Tumbl?? haha thank yall so much and happy reading vvvv So I originally choreographed this piece with every intention of creating it for the #BELIEVEtourAuditions but I absolutely did not expect for this song to have such a humungous impact on my life. Once I got a chance to really sit down and listen to the actual content of the song, it struck me that what Justin was singing about, is a very common situation that many of us have previously found ourselves in. Almost every one of us has experienced, at a point in life, a time where we've either had to be the stronger/optimistic part of a relationship, or the weaker. Whether its between yourself and your girlfriend, you and your kids or even you and yourself; theres eventually a part of that relationship where one half just wants to quit and give up. But it takes two to make a thing go right. Its the reason why we have parents, why we have older siblings, why we have someone to fall in love with and constantly tell us, NO MATTER WHAT, that everything is going to be okay, just as long as you have faith in your heart and hope in your brain. No matter how hard the fight if you have those two then, the stars will align and work itself out. Its impossible for me to summarize in such a small amount of words the magnitude of how much this piece means to me. I've yet to ever truly invest 100% of my being into a piece of art and I feel as though finally I'm at the point where I finally can. I literally choreographed this piece in under an hour and I feel as though its one of the greatest things I've ever produced in my entire life. If given the chance to explain the actual story in real life, I'd love to tell it to you, but for the meantime, for me, PLEASE watch it in HD and throw on some headphones or get to where you can hear the music very well. Every song you've never heard sounds exactly the same. So if you could, please take 1 minute and 30 seconds to REALLY listen to this song while you watch my choreography. I'm giving you guys a part of me that no one has ever really owned, and now all of you are here to break down this barriers/borders/and walls here with me. I learned SO much about myself just by listening to this song, and I hope that me visualizing everything helps make and impact on you as well. Thank you guys for your time, Enjoy :) HUGE thanks to Ronn for recording this on a whim for me. Faith really does guide everything in life. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: youtube.com

Harry Reid (D-Nev.) on Sunday, accusing the Senate majority leader of lying on the Senate floor when he said he’d heard Mitt Romney didn’t pay taxes for a decade. “I’ve been around this town for a while,” Graham told Candy Crowley on CNN’s "State of the Union." “I actually like Harry.
